YAHOO.widget.TabView.name: YAHOO.widget.TabView

tabs.description: The Tabs belonging to the TabView instance.

activeIndex.description: The index of the tab currently active.

orientation.description: How the Tabs should be oriented relative to the TabView.

params.name: el
params.description:
(optional) The html 
element that represents the TabView, or the attribute object to use. 
An element will be created if none provided.

params.name: attr
params.description:
(optional) A key map of the tabView's 
initial attributes.  Ignored if first arg is attributes object.

constructors.description: A widget to control tabbed views.

beforeActiveTabChange.description:
Fires before the activeTab is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeActiveTabChange
<YAHOO.widget.Tab> prevValue the currently active tab
<YAHOO.widget.Tab> newValue the tab to be made active

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeActiveTabChange', handler);

orientationChange.description:
Fires after the orientation is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type orientationChange
<String> prevValue the former orientation
<String> newValue the new orientation

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('orientationChange', handler);

activeTabChange.description:
Fires after the activeTab is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type activeTabChange
<YAHOO.widget.Tab> prevValue the formerly active tab
<YAHOO.widget.Tab> newValue the new active tab

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('activeTabChange', handler);

beforeOrientationChange.description:
Fires before the orientation is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeOrientationChange
<String> prevValue the current orientation
<String> newValue the new orientation to be applied

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeOrientationChange', handler);

return.description: int

params.name: tab
params.description: The tab whose index will be returned.

getTabIndex.description: Returns the index of given tab.

return.description: void

params.name: item
params.description: The Tab instance to be removed.

removeTab.description: Removes the specified Tab from the TabView.

contentTransition.description: The transiton to use when switching between tabs.

return.description: void

createTabs.description: Creates Tab instances from a collection of HTMLElements.

params.name: elements
params.description: The elements to use for Tabs.

params.name: attr
params.description: Hash of initial attributes

return.description: String

toString.description: Provides a readable name for the TabView instance.

return.description: void

params.name: e
params.description: The Dom event that is being handled.

return.description: void

params.name: tab
params.description: A Tab instance to add.

params.name: index
params.description: The position to add the tab.

addTab.description:
Adds a Tab to the TabView instance.  
If no index is specified, the tab is added to the end of the tab list.

return.description: YAHOO.widget.Tab

params.name: index
params.description: The position of the Tab.

getTab.description: Returns the Tab instance at the specified index.

CLASSNAME.description: The className to add when building from scratch.

TAB_PARENT_CLASSNAME.description:
The className of the HTMLElement containing the TabView's tab elements
to look for when building from existing markup, or to add when building
from scratch. 
All childNodes of the tab container are treated as Tabs when building
from existing markup.

CONTENT_PARENT_CLASSNAME.description:
The className of the HTMLElement containing the TabView's label elements
to look for when building from existing markup, or to add when building
from scratch. 
All childNodes of the content container are treated as content elements when
building from existing markup.

_tabParent.description: The container of the tabView's label elements.

_contentParent.description: The container of the tabView's content elements.

YAHOO.widget.TabView.description: A widget to control tabbed views.

YAHOO.util.Element.name: YAHOO.util.Element

element.description: The HTMLElement the Element instance refers to.

params.name: el
params.description:
The html element that 
represents the Element.

params.name: map
params.description: A key-value map of initial config names and values

constructors.description:
Element provides an interface to an HTMLElement's attributes and common
methods.  Other commonly used attributes are added as well.

available.description:
Fires when the Element's HTMLElement can be retrieved by Id.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type available
<HTMLElement> target the HTMLElement bound to this Element instance

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var target = e.target};
myTabs.addListener('available', handler);

contentReady.description:
Fires when the Element's HTMLElement subtree is rendered.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type contentReady
<HTMLElement> target the HTMLElement bound to this Element instance

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var target = e.target};
myTabs.addListener('contentReady', handler);

params.name: deep
params.description: Whether or not to do a deep clone

params.name: type
params.description: The name of the event to listen for

params.name: fn
params.description: The handler to call when the event fires

params.name: obj
params.description: A variable to pass to the handler

params.name: scope
params.description: The object to use for the scope of the handler

addListener.description:
Adds a listener for the given event.  These may be DOM or 
customEvent listeners.  Any event that is fired via fireEvent
can be listened for.  All handlers receive an event object.

params.name: className
params.description: The className to remove

params.name: element
params.description: The HTMLElement to insert

params.name: before
params.description:
The HTMLElement to insert
the element before.

params.name: scope
params.description: The object to use for the scope of the handler

params.name: tag
params.description: The tagName to collect

conjunction with class name

params.name: parentNode
params.description: The node to append to

params.name: before
params.description: An optional node to insert before

appendTo.description: Appends the HTMLElement into either the supplied parentNode.

return.description: The current value of the property

params.name: property
params.description: The style property to retrieve

params.name: value
params.description: The value to apply to the style property

The Element instance to
register the config to.

params.description: A key-value map of the config's params

_registerHTMLAttr.description: Sets the value of the property and fires beforeChange and change events.

params.description: The name of the event to listen for

YAHOO.util.Element.description:
Element provides an interface to an HTMLElement's attributes and common
methods.  Other commonly used attributes are added as well.

YAHOO.widget.Tab.name: YAHOO.widget.Tab

disabled.description: Whether or not the tab is disabled.

dataTimeout.description: Number if milliseconds before aborting and calling failure handler.

contentEl.description: The HTMLElement that contains the tab's content.

href.description: The href of the tab's anchor element.

dataSrc.description: The tab's data source, used for loading content dynamically.

label.description: The event that triggers the tab's activation.

loadMethod.description: The method to use for the data request.

contentVisible.description: The Whether or not the tab's content is visible.

cacheData.description: Whether or not content should be reloaded for every view.

active.description:
Whether or not the tab is currently active.
If a dataSrc is set for the tab, the content will be loaded from
the given source.

labelEl.description: The element that contains the tab's label.

dataLoaded.description: Whether or not any data has been loaded from the server.

params.name: element
params.description:
(optional) The html element that 
represents the TabView. An element will be created if none provided.

params.name: properties
params.description: A key map of initial properties

constructors.description: A representation of a Tab's label and content.

contentChange.description:
Fires after the tab content is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type contentChange
<String> prevValue the previous value
<Boolean> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('contentChange', handler);

activeChange.description:
Fires after the active state is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type activeChange
<Boolean> prevValue the previous value
<Boolean> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('activeChange', handler);

beforeContentChange.description:
Fires before the tab content is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeContentChange
<String> prevValue the current value
<String> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeContentChange', handler);

beforeActiveChange.description:
Fires before the active state is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeActiveChange
<Boolean> prevValue the current value
<Boolean> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeActiveChange', handler);

labelChange.description:
Fires after the tab label is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type labelChange
<String> prevValue the previous value
<String> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('labelChange', handler);

beforeLabelChange.description:
Fires before the tab label is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeLabelChange
<String> prevValue the current value
<String> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeLabelChange', handler);

params.name: attr
params.description: Hash of initial attributes

return.description: String

toString.description: Provides a readable name for the tab.

DISABLED_CLASSNAME.description: The class name applied to disabled tabs.

LOADING_CLASSNAME.description: The class name applied to dynamic tabs while loading.

LABEL_INNER_TAGNAME.description: The default tag name for a Tab's inner element.

ACTIVE_CLASSNAME.description: The class name applied to active tabs.

loadHandler.description: Object containing success and failure callbacks for loading data.

dataConnection.description:
Provides a reference to the connection request object when data is
loaded dynamically.

YAHOO.widget.Tab.description: A representation of a Tab's label and content.

tabview.name: tabview
tabview.description: The tabview module provides a widget for managing content bound to tabs.
